page.title: 01General desc. of Patchway
page.content: The "D" block is divided from NE to SW by a scarp slope, separating the flood plain of the River Severn from the higher ground, which rises to 84m. Diagonally across the block, following the line of the scarp, runs the M5. The largest residential area is part of the Patchway Estate. The block also includes the village of Easter Compton and the hamlets of Over and Compton Greenfield. Filton Airfield occupies the SE corner, the runway extending along the S edge of the block. On the edge of the estate are warehouses and a hypermarket. In the NE corner, the Patchway Railway Tunnel debouches into a cutting. Also in the block is a breeding establishment for the Bristol Zoo, and a permanent Gipsy Camp. Most of the area is given over to grassland farming.
